brewery.brewery_description:
WE’RE FOR BEER. Village Days Brewing Co. is all about fresh, local beer and good times! Beer is a thing of fragile beauty – so it’s always best enjoyed right where it’s made.

WE’RE FOR PEOPLE. If the pandemic has taught us anything, it’s that community – the local ‘village’– is more important than ever. Our taproom provides a welcoming, spacious environment for locals to come together and connect over a few handcrafted brews.

WE’RE FOR PLACE. As the first brewery in the City of Ryde, our beers are inspired by the rich history of our area, and bring together the best ingredients from around the world.

items.checkin_comment: Distinctive bitter hops forward ! Nicely served in a hip urban brewery setting- Salut !

user.bio: Cementhead who enjoys good beers after a dusty day in the factory !

items.checkin_comment: A little plain Jane for a pale, but easy going and pleasant enough to make up for every other bottlo being closed. Hint of honeydew and rockmelon, but tropics are still MIA.

user.bio: Trying and failing to find beers better than what comes out of DJ's imagination...

beer.beer_description: A balanced pale ale, this beer was originally one of our owner Dan's homebrew recipes. Citra and Amarillo hops give a perfect blend of citrus and tropical fruit - this beer smells almost as good as it tastes.

items.badge_description: Canning is all the rage and it's not hard to see why - travels well, more environmentally friendly, and no need to carry your bottle opener. That's 460 checkins with the serving style of Can. Try 5 more for Level 93! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast
Do you come from the land down under, where beer does flow, and men chunder? That's at least 475 different beers from Australia. Try 5 more for Level 96!

beer.beer_description: A balanced pale ale, this beer was originally one of our owner Dan's homebrew recipes. Citra and Amarillo hops give a perfect blend of citrus and tropical fruit - this beer smells almost as good as it tastes.

items.badge_description: Your quest to quench your thirst leaves no stone unturned! That's at least 35 distinct venues!
Ahh, the trusty pale ale; crisp, refreshing, and always a good choice in a bind. That's 40 different Pale Ales or American Pale Wheats. Try 5 more for Level 9.

beer.beer_description: A balanced pale ale, this beer was originally one of our owner Dan's homebrew recipes. Citra and Amarillo hops give a perfect blend of citrus and tropical fruit - this beer smells almost as good as it tastes.

A balanced pale ale, this beer was originally one of our owner Dan's homebrew recipes. Citra and Amarillo hops give a perfect blend of citrus and tropical fruit - this beer smells almost as good as it tastes.

items.checkin_comment: On the bike 51km into my city circle.

beer.beer_description:
This beer was brewed in collaboration with our neighbour Frankie from Frankie's Wheels. He's been a great friend of the brewery and so when he suggested we brew a special beer to celebrate the one year anniversary of his skate park opening, we jumped at the chance.

Frankie fancied a wheat beer, so the starting point was our delicious Hefeweizen. But given the time of year, we wanted something a bit lighter and more refreshing. So we added a dose of corn to the malt bill and finished things off with American Cascade hops for a punch of citrus. Not exactly traditional, but the result is spectacular.

A balanced pale ale, this beer was originally one of our owner Dan's homebrew recipes. Citra and Amarillo hops give a perfect blend of citrus and tropical fruit - this beer smells almost as good as it tastes.

items.checkin_comment: Still not too late, after Paddy's Day, to get in one more serving of the medicinal black 🍺

beer.beer_description: Our beautiful black stout gives coffee and chocolate on the nose, while the addition of oats provides a smooth sweetness to offset the roasted barley. It's like the beer equivalent to an espresso martini.

Our beautiful black stout gives coffee and chocolate on the nose, while the addition of oats provides a smooth sweetness to offset the roasted barley. It's like the beer equivalent to an espresso martini.

items.badge_name: Beyond a Shadow of a Stout (Level 34)
items.badge_description: We all love Stouts, and now we have a dedicated badge to celebrate your dedication to these dark, top-fermented beer in multiple variations, like Oatmeal, Milk and more! Which one will you start with? That's 170 different beers with the style of Stout. Try 5 more for Level 35!

beer.beer_description: This traditional Bavarian wheat beer is an excellent breakfast beer (and it’s also highly delightful in the afternoon, evening and at night). In addition to the mouthfeel and flavour of the wheat malt, the specialised yeast produces wonderful banana and clove flavours.

items.badge_description: It may not be cloudy outside, but your brew definitely is! That’s at least 15 different hefeweizens. Try 5 more to unlock Level 4.

beer.beer_description: This traditional Bavarian wheat beer is an excellent breakfast beer (and it’s also highly delightful in the afternoon, evening and at night). In addition to the mouthfeel and flavour of the wheat malt, the specialised yeast produces wonderful banana and clove flavours.

items.badge_description: Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 225 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 46!

beer.beer_description: A balanced pale ale, this beer was originally one of our owner Dan's homebrew recipes. Citra and Amarillo hops give a perfect blend of citrus and tropical fruit - this beer smells almost as good as it tastes.

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 150 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 31!

It takes the perfect amount of light, the right framing and a touch of creative love to get the perfect picture of your brew. Now it’s time to drink it! That's 415 check-ins with a photo.  Try 5 more for Level 84!

beer.beer_description: A balanced pale ale, this beer was originally one of our owner Dan's homebrew recipes. Citra and Amarillo hops give a perfect blend of citrus and tropical fruit - this beer smells almost as good as it tastes.

This traditional Bavarian wheat beer is an excellent breakfast beer (and it’s also highly delightful in the afternoon, evening and at night). In addition to the mouthfeel and flavour of the wheat malt, the specialised yeast produces wonderful banana and clove flavours.

This red IPA is all about the balance of rich malty sweetness and dank hoppy bitterness. German specialty malts give a depth of colour and flavour, while American Cascade and Centennial hops provide a punch of citrus.

Our malt forward German lager delivers a delicious bready grain flavour with hints of honey sweetness. A helping of German Spalt hops ensures the finish is crisp and refreshing. Poured straight from the tank – making it the freshest beer around.
Our mid-strength may only be 3.5% ABV but it sure doesn't taste like it! This beer is all about massive tropical fruit flavour and aroma. Perfect for long summer days.

Our beautiful black stout gives coffee and chocolate on the nose, while the addition of oats provides a smooth sweetness to offset the roasted barley. It's like the beer equivalent to an espresso martini.

Delicately flavoured with fresh vanilla beans and a cheeky touch of spiced rum, it’s darkly distinctive. Drift away with hints of dark chocolate and coffee, rounded out into a rich malty sweetness. Don’t miss this drop.

Ringing in Oktoberfest in Bavarian style, our Märzen gets the party started. A bigger-bodied lager than our 2111, this tasty character is straight outta Munich (via Gladesville). With pure, slightly sweet malt notes, it’s fresh and caramel-intense. Pairs perfectly with pretzels. Prost!

Our fruity Extra Pale Ale is the perfect summer drink. Mosaic and Enigma hops bring grassy, citrus and berry flavours. Combined with a hint of bitterness and a crisp finish, it’s the perfect refreshment on a balmy village day.

This beer was brewed in collaboration with our neighbour Frankie from Frankie's Wheels. He's been a great friend of the brewery and so when he suggested we brew a special beer to celebrate the one year anniversary of his skate park opening, we jumped at the chance.

Frankie fancied a wheat beer, so the starting point was our delicious Hefeweizen. But given the time of year, we wanted something a bit lighter and more refreshing. So we added a dose of corn to the malt bill and finished things off with American Cascade hops for a punch of citrus. Not exactly traditional, but the result is spectacular.
